data.title: Your Name directorâ€™s new movie has its first trailer
data.meta_description: Suzume no Tojimari is the latest movie from Makoto Shinkai, the director of Your Name and Weathering with You, and is set to be released in Japan in November.
data.text:
Makoto Shinkai is back with a new movie about young people trying to navigate an imperiled world. The Your Name directorâ€™s latest movie is currently called Suzume no Tojimari, and the first trailer came out over the weekend. Suzume no Tojimari, which roughly translates to Suzumeâ€™s Locking Up, is set to be released Nov. 11 in Japan, but doesnâ€™t have a release date for North America just yet.

According to the movieâ€™s plot summary, it follows 17-year-old Suzume who meets a young man looking for a door. When Suzume finds the mysterious door and opens it, doors all over Japan begin opening, unleashing all kinds of chaos and destruction around the country. Itâ€™s up to Suzume to close them once again.

This first trailer doesnâ€™t give much of the movieâ€™s plot away, but it does looks absolutely gorgeous. The trailer includes images of ruined cities and the magical doors themselves, but, just like Shinkaiâ€™s previous two movies, everything seems a little bit tragic too.

These kinds of movies about young people in seemingly doomed worlds have become a bit of a signature of Shinkaiâ€™s, but itâ€™s hard to complain when heâ€™s so clearly good at telling these stories. Both of his last two movies, Your Name and Weathering with You, were met with massive critical and commercial success all around the world.

While thereâ€™s no official release date for the U.S. just yet, it could be a while before the movie arrives. Your Name took nearly a year to reach the United States after its premiere in Japan, while Weathering with You took around six months.
